name: NiMa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
3 weeks ago
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Overall, our stay at this container home was 5-stars. Absolutely no complaints. This place is a hidden gem in Stockton! It was so quiet and peaceful, that I could hear the crickets chirping during the day.
I was pleasantly surprised at how spacious the home felt! There was a door that sectioned off the bedroom from the bathroom and another door from the bathroom to the kitchen, so there was privacy amongst other guests. The windows were mirror tinted, so we were able to enjoy the view of the large oak trees and pond without having to worry about anyone looking in.
During the day, we hung out by the pond and sandy beach-like area. The pond was so massive, it seemed more like a lake! At night, we lit a fire pit, put the lights on to the pond waterfall and enjoyed the quiet sounds of nature and water. It was quite the experience.
Shelly and Brian were an amazing host. He was very communicative with us with when we had any questions. I will definitely be renting from them again!

This cottage is detached from the main home but you are on the same property. It's an adorable one bedroom place, well designed and simply styled.
Check-in and out was easy, Kate showed us the ropes, then left us to our own until we messaged her we were leaving.
We are tall and the bed sunk in the middle, slightly. Everything was super clean and easy to operate. I like scalding hot showers and this one definitely got hot, but not that one notch above where I like it. I likely could have adjusted the water heater since it's in the unit but it didn't bother me enough to bother.

review_text:
My partner and I are from NV, and were in town for school purposes. Our one-month stay at Debbie's and Jose's AirBnB was exceptional. Despite other family members living with them, noise level was minimal and it is quiet at night, thanks to a thoughtful curfew. Their dog, Loki, added charm. Make sure to shut the red fence gate and check again!
The place has vibrant design with all essentials needed and even a workspace for Zoom meetings. Dedicated parking spot eased logistics.
Debbie and Jose's constant communication and kindness made the stay memorable. The location is ideal - near coffee shops, food places, and 10 minutes from St. Joseph's Hospital. Plus, it's a gateway to exciting weekend trips to cities like San Francisco, San Jose, and Sacramento, all within 1-2 hours. I wish I can write more about this place (character limit 1000).
Overall, whether you are visiting for work, school, or leisure, this is an ideal place for long-term stays and experiences. We'd happily return!

review_text:
Stayed at Nhiâ€™s place over the holiday while visiting family. It was as the photos depicted. The home had everything we needed. The vibe inside is Marimekko/Scandanavian -nice and cozy. Quality mattresses and bedding. Iâ€™ve stayed in so many places with the worst mattresses which is why I give a special mention to these lovely beds. We were 3 adults but it is kid and family friendly. We were able to have coffee out on the back patio in the sun.
Our dog was welcome- thank you, Nhi!!
The work space was sunny, quiet, nice chair with back support and the Wi-Fi was spot on.
It is a couple of blocks off Hammer Ln which is a busy thoroughfare but minimal noise on the street.
Easy to get to Lodi, wineries, Consumes Wetlands outside of Thornton (bird watching!) as well as Stocktonâ€™s shopping and restaurants. We also visited Haggin Museum- a gem.
We will stay here again

review_text: Place was ok, but a little disappointing. The things were not really put in place for cooking food (missing cutting board, bowls). The cutting board I eventually received were the cheapest quality, whereas I feel like something better would be an investment worth making since it's something that would be used by other guests. There was an odd design with the bathroom where the mirror is positioned in a way that you see yourself in clear view when you are taking a #2 on the toilet (I don't imagine the host putting something like that in their own home lol). The location seems lacking as well (15 minutes to go to downtown or a decent grocery store, neighbor's dog barks whole day, sometimes during bedtime hours). Overall, feel like there could have been more to make the place more comfortable.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Several good points about this place and the owner. Excellent.
BUT, sad to note:
1. A coffee maker is a standard, typical item to have at 99% of Airbnbs I've stayed at over the years.
It was missing here....plus NO way to heat up water except for the microwave.
Hmmm.....$20 is the cost for a basic coffee maker.
Before I arrived, I queried about a coffee maker, but no response occurred, despite my query of 24+ hours before I arrived. Hmmmm.
2. Few dishes to cook with at the place. Hmmmm.....
3. No chair to sit in, though plenty of room to add one.
4. Desk? Not easy to sit in a bar chair and work on a computer to do work. Adding a lower, portable card table would be appropriate, please.
Otherwise, most important: safe neighborhood.....

Stayed one night
review_text:
Teresa's Private Room in Guest Suite is perfect for a quick, no frills overnight spot and for those who do not want to interact in person with the AirBnB host. Privacy for her guests seemed high on Teresa's list.
The place matches its photos and is tucked away in a residential area. One would need a car to get around the area. A quick jump, onto the 5 and back off again, had us in downtown Stockton. Street parking at her place was abundant.
Teresa is quick to respond if you have any needs or requests. If you are looking for a host who is eager to interact with you in person; she is not that person. We never met her.

Stayed one night
review_text: Was not impressed with this room, glad I was only here for a quick over night stay. There were an excessive amount of flies, including dead ones, which I found throughout the room. I also found change on the floor (and crumbs). All this leads me to believe the place wasn't properly cleaned before my arrival. The AC wall unit was filthy, there were spider webs in the corners of the walls, the "kitchenette" was very poorly stocked- no silverware at all, only one very small pan, no salt, pepper, oil, etc. When we arrived we noticed we only had one towel, no wash rags and no dish towels. I messaged Teresa but didn't hear back from her until the next morning after I had already left. To be fair I didn't bother informing Teresa of the issues with the cleanliness because it was already a little late when I arrived and I knew I would be leaving in the morning but considering how long it took her to respond to my towel request I doubt that there was much she could have done to fix my complaints for this stay.

There were only a few hooks on the wall to hold clothes, but no closet, dresser or clothes rack- so I had limited space when hanging my scrubs/business clothes as I was there for work. There is a tall window with thin curtains facing the bed which could be an issue for a guest there for work especially working overnight shift and sleeping during the day. Bed could be more comfortable, but the basics are taken care of- such as street parking, private bathroom, tv, wifi, microwave, sink and mini fridge. A great place for a couple days stay, but might be a bit of a challenge for a long term stay. Again, good value for the price, you get what you pay for.

name: Dorian
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
Â·
January 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Context: we were traveling along the beautiful West coast on a 3000-mile roadtrip. We needed a simple place to warm up our hearts and souls after a long day of driving and hiking. We are simple people and expect a clean place, a warm bed and a shower, that's all. Nothing complicated.
To our unpleasant surprise, Teresa's place did not meet our basic expectations. The studio was very cold. We were at the end of December (the 31st to be specific) and, at night, the temperatures were close to freezing. When booking any Airbnb in winter, one would expect blankets and heating to be provided. While there was no blanket in sight, there was indeed a small electric heater. However, this was a crappy heater, worth at most $25 and bought at the local supermarket. Nobody should ever expect their guests to stay warm which such a heating situation. It was not suitable to heat a studio in the middle of winter.
So, we didn't not get a warm bed, but maybe we'd have more luck with the cleanliness of the place? Again, huge disappointment. The studio was not clean. The sheets smelled like they had come out of a cabin from the 60s. Some unusual objects were spread out throughout the studio. Under the bed, which we discovered after winning a battle against a huge spider (the biggest we've seen in California), there was a lot of dust, hairpins and food packagins, signs that the place had not been cleaned in a while.
To top it all off, the water coming out of the pipes tasted like it had rotten. I had never tasted rotten water before but, I swear to god, this water smelled and tasted like the pipes were rotten.
For the rest, do not expect anything more than what's in the description. The microwave is there, but we could not get our hands on even a glass or a spoon, or actually anything else that a traveller would need.
Overall, unless you're looking for a spartiate experience with cold and dusty sheets, like in the Ancient Greece, do not book this place. You'd honestly be better off staying at the closest motel.

name: Alan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2021
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Great communication. A beautiful place in a very nice neighborhood, just south of downtown Stockton. Had no problems finding the place or parking.
The AirBNB is in a separate unit attached to the main house. It has a microwave, a fridge, an Amazon Fire TV, a *VERY* comfortable bed, and a private bathroom that is part of the unit. Everything was spotless, and there was plenty of room. The Wi-Fi was blazingly fast. There were also plenty of plugs to recharge my electronics.
The only things I could say, is that the bathroom does have a couple of medium steps that you have to navigate to go in or out. If you are a person with mobility issues, that could possibly be a problem. It was fine for me. Also, as mentioned in the listing, the unit does not have a smoke/Carbon Monoxide detector. That was not an issue to me, as I travel with my own just for situations like this.
It was a wonderful stay. I would gladly stay here again. Thank you.

They sent someone to take a look at it but it looked like it didn't get fixed. But we manage to be ok without it because they're two other sinks to use.
May look into more seating in the living space because there just wasn't enough seats to go around so we had to move chairs from all over the house to accommodate everyone.
Adolfo and Stevie were great. They were very responsive. As long as you communicated to them what was going on, it was fine.
Thanks for offering up your home. We look forward to next time.

review_text: As a business traveler, driving on the road through 8 states, I stay at a lot of Airbnbs. When I arrived at this one the first thing I noticed was the bed looked caved in in the middle. When I went to sleep, I sunk deep into it, and indeed it was dented in. I was okay after the first night but after 2 more nights my back was hurting. The side of the bed was dented in, too. I've NEVER seen a bed like this at any Airbnb. I let the hostess know 2 times about the bed and she did not respond. The room was on the cold side during the heavy winter storms. It was nice to have a refrigerator freezer and microwave. The first night I stayed there on a Friday night, there was a big loud party celebration that went till after midnight. I put ear plugs in and I was able to sleep

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My stay. at Teresa's absolutely fit my needs. I was there for 4 days with my dog while I attended a dog show in the area. This Airbnb was ideal for me. It was a very safe and accessible area right off the freeway. (N0 freeway noise.) The shower was great. The bed very comfortable for me. I found the room and bathroom very spacious with great hooks on the wall to hang things since there was no closet. I put the microwave and small frig to good use. I had to go out and purchase toilet paper and paper towels as the only paper product in the room was a partial roll of toilet paper. There are also no plates or silverware in the room so I was glad I brought a few things from home. The walls are very thin and I could hear a tv and people talking when I was home during the day, but never at night. My communication with Teresa during my stay could not have been better. The internet went down ....fixed in 10 minutes and she was not even home when I called. The electrical outlet in the bathroom was not working and she dropped off an electrical cord so I could use my hairdryer in the morning. This is far better than a hotel stay in price. I will visit again .....hands down. Thanks Teresa.

Stayed about a week
review_text: I usually like to check-in when it is still light outside, but I ended up getting here fairly late in the evening. That said, I felt totally safe in Teresa's neighborhood and really appreciated that the walkway to the sliding door of the room was well lit, and the side gate was propped open. This place has all of the basics in terms of a bed, lights, desk area, computer chair, outlets, bathroom and even a microwave and mini fridge. I used the microwave, but not the mini fridge. Some of the outlets were non functioning, but it wasn't a huge problem because I always had enough working ones to plug in my laptop and cell phone. There's no closet space or hangers, but there are hooks near the bed and over the bathroom door that made hangers unnecessary. Teresa was a great host and messaged me about where to find the key on my first day. She also messaged me to ask if it was too hot and if I needed air conditioning which was very thoughtful of her. Even with the hot weather, I never felt uncomfortable. This was a much better experience than what I would have gotten with any of the hotels in/around Stockton - definitely recommended.
